noun.description: A small swirling mass of something, especially snow or leaves, moved by sudden gusts of wind.

verb.description: (especially of snow or leaves) be moved in small swirling masses by sudden gusts of wind.
examples: gusts of snow flurried through the door

origin: Late 17th century: from obsolete flurr fly up, flutter, whirr (imitative), probably influenced by hurry.
